title: How are the social science disciplines different from one another? - Quora

response.answer_text: email sez: “Cess Wang requested your answer How are the social science disciplines different from one another?” the word is STYLIZATION - Google Search “causing to conform to a particular style.” “the imposition of standards or regulations;” SOCIAL Science AIN’T the awareness of ACTUAL differences between oak and granite and oxygen and iron. SOCIAL Science is the Obsession over APPARENT VARIATIONS between feathers and scales and fur and slime. The Differences in the Disciplines between a steel worker and stone cutter and lumber jack and a chemist are MECHANICAL The Differences in the “Disciplines” between a “Social Worker” and an “Economist” and a “Human Resources Director” and a “Corrections Officer” are IMAGERY. You canNOT CLEAVE an Atom with a Double-Bit 3 pound Sager Axe But if you BELIEVE Words and Numbers on a piece of paper are IMPRESSED By ANY Difference in your choice of Hair Style, Jewelry, Spelling and Punctuation, THEN You’re a SOCIAL Scientist.
